title: ‘Angel’ girl, 10, kills herself ‘after being picked on by bullies at school’
text:
Allison Ruth Wendell died by suicide on Sunday, with police now investigating whether the 10 year-old may have been driven to her death by bullying at school (Pictures: GoFundMe)

A 10 year-old girl killed herself after being bullied at school, police believe.

The youngster, identified as Allison Ruth Wendel, was found dead by her nine year-old sister at their home in Santa Ana, California, on Sunday.

Further details on how the youngster, known as Ali, died have not been released, but a Santa Ana Police Department spokesman confirmed they were investigating ‘rumors of bullying.’

Family friends said afterwards: ‘We lost a great little angel.’

Detectives from Santa Ana Police Department arrived at Hazard Elementary School, where Allison studied, on Monday to further investigate the bullying claims.

Ali’s family are believed to have regularly monitored their daughter’s phone and social media accounts (Picture: GoFundMe)

They plan to interview those who knew the tragic youngster, and comb her social media pages and text messages to see if bullying had caused her to take her own life.

Allison’s parents are said to have had access to their daughter’s phone, and checked it regularly to make sure she was not being picked on.

'European girl', 10, drowns in hot tub in Dubai after hair gets stuck in filter

Classmate Jacob Ortiz was among those who paid tribute to Allison.

He told CBSLA: ‘She was always like funny…she was always really nice to everybody.

‘She would give a lot of people hugs a lot.’

Detectives have visited Hazard Elementary School, where Allison was a student, to try and establish whether she had fallen victim to bullies (Picture: Google Maps)

A rosary vigil was scheduled to be held outside Allison’s home on Monday evening.

A spokesman for Garden Grove School District, which includes Hazard Elementary School said: ‘We are deeply saddened by the tragic passing of one of our students.

‘We have our crisis counselors on site today and throughout the week to ensure students and staff have support during this difficult time.

‘While the Santa Ana Police Department is conducting a thorough investigation, we have no evidence to support this rumor.

‘Hazard Elementary School has a longstanding PBIS (Positive Behavior Interventions and Supports) program and takes a proactive approach to promote a positive school culture

For 24/7 confidential emotional support, contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 1-800-273-8255 in the US. For the UK contact Samaritans on 116123 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see www.samaritans.org for details.
description: Allison Ruth Wendel was found dead at her home in Santa Ana, California, on Sunday
